title: Review & Video: Spring Offensive – A Stutter and A Start
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/04/Spring_Offensive-Casual.jpg "Spring_Offensive-Casual")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/6525-review-video-spring-offensive-a-stutter-and-a-start/attachment/spring_offensive-casual-3)

Since the Valentines Day release of their acoustic EP Between Me And You, Oxford based quintet Spring Offensive have been extremely busy; recording new tracks, filming a music video and lining up a host of UK gigs. New single A Stutter and a Start is relatively understated when compared to their previous release, the fourteen minute epic that was The First Of Many Dreams About Monsters. However it’s still a cracking track; jagged guitars and somber, honest vocals make up A Stutter and A Start, which tells the story of a person in turmoil, with relationships, their well being and even their car. The video follows a simple thematical issue, a one take job showing the band helping out the protagonist with his every day chores, ranging from cleaning his teeth to stumbling home drunk from a night out.

excerpt.full: However it’s still a cracking track; jagged guitars and somber, honest vocals make up A Stutter and A Start, which tells the story of a person in turmoil, with relationships, their well being and even their car.
